</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Smoothly change the fog over given time (in seconds). See also [[fogParams]].<br><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature arma3</title><part><name index="1"/><value>This command is MP synchronised, if executed on server, the changes will propagate globally. If executed on client effect is temporary as it will soon change to the server setting.</value></part></template></value></part><part><name>Description</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> time [[setFog]] fog </value></part><part><name>Syntax</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> time: [[Number]] - transition time to the new value </value></part><part><name>Parameter 1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> fog: [[Number]] - fog density. Range 0..1 </value></part><part><name>Parameter 2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>Return value</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> time [[setFog]] [fogValue, fogDecay, fogBase] &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; (''Since Arma 3'') </value></part><part><name>Syntax2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> time: [[Number]] - transition time to the new value </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER21</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> [fogValue, fogDecay, fogBase]: [[Array]] of [[Number]]:
* fogValue: [[Number]] - normal [[fog]] value that represents fog density at ''fogBase'' level. Range 0..1
* fogDecay: [[Number]] - decay of fog density with altitude. Range -1..1
* fogBase: [[Number]] - base altitude ([[Position#PositionASL|ASL]]) of fog (in meters). Range -5000..5000 </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER22</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE2</name>=<value>

____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>15 [[setFog]] 0.5;</code> </value></part><part><name>Example 1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> Force no fog: <code>0 [[setFog]] 0;
<template lineStart="1"><title>codecomment</title><part><name index="1"/><value>// [[forceWeatherChange]]; // change is immediate</value></part></template>
999999 [[setFog]] 0;</code> </value></part><part><name>Example 2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> <code>0 [[setFog]] [1, 0.01, 0];</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE3</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x4</name>=<value> Mountain fog, starts from 70m ASL and thickens more the higher you climb: <code>0 [[setFog]] [1, -1, 70];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE4</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x5</name>=<value> Valley fog, starts from 60m ASL and thickens more the lower you descend: <code>0 [[setFog]] [1, 1, 60];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE5</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x6</name>=<value> Fooooog on the waaaater: <code>0 [[setFog]] [1, 1, 0];</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE6</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
</value></part><part><name>mp</name>=<value>  Pre-Arma 3, each client and the server could have different fog values </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value>[[Arma 3 Improved Fog]], [[fog]], [[fogParams]], [[fogForecast]], [[nextWeatherChange]], [[forceWeatherChange]], [[setRain]] </value></part><part><name>See also</name>=<value>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">
<dt class="note">[[User:Ceeeb|Ceeeb]]
<dd class="note">Only one script command induced weather change (either [[setOvercast]] or setFog) can be happening at a time.
Starting a new weather change will immediately halt the current weather change.
[[setRain|SetRain]] changes are independent and can occur simultaneously to a weather change.

<dd class="notedate">Posted on December 15, 2015 - 14:32 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Zapat|Zapat]]</dt>
<dd class="note">[[setTimeMultiplier]] DOES affect transition time.</dd>

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on January 10, 2019 - 10:23 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:killzone_kid|killzone_kid]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
A little information about how Alt Syntax works. The ''fogValue'' is normal [[fog]] value that could be set independently with original [[setFog]] command. ''fogBase'' is the ASL altitude at which the fog will start. 0 is the sea level. ''fogDecay'' is how defined the fog start is. The more defined, the denser is the fog. 1 (or -1) are the max values. If it is positive the fog will be generated below ''fogBase'' line, if negative, above it. If ''fogDecay'' is small, the fog will transition more smoothly from no fog to full fog, and because of that it will cross ''fogBase'' line by quite a lot, depending on how small is ''fogDecay'' value. Current values of ''fogDecay'' and ''fogBase'' can be retrieved with [[fogParams]] 
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
